title: Policies for information security
description: Define and establish information security policies that are approved, published, communicated, and reviewed.

title: Information security roles and responsibilities
description: Define and allocate information security roles and responsibilities in accordance with organizational needs.

title: Segregation of duties
description: Separate conflicting duties and areas of responsibility to reduce opportunities for unauthorized or unintentional modification or misuse.

title: Management responsibilities
description: Ensure management requires all personnel to apply information security in accordance with established policies and procedures.

title: Contact with authorities
description: Maintain appropriate contact with relevant authorities (e.g., regulatory, law enforcement).

title: Contact with special interest groups
description: Maintain appropriate contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums.

title: Threat intelligence
description: Collect and analyze information about information security threats to produce threat intelligence.

title: Information security in project management
description: Address information security throughout project management, regardless of project type.

title: Inventory of information and other associated assets
description: Identify information and other associated assets, define appropriate protection responsibilities, and maintain an inventory.

title: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets
description: Establish rules for the acceptable use of information and assets associated with information and information processing facilities.

title: Return of assets
description: Ensure all employees, contractors and third-party users return organization-owned assets upon termination of employment, contract or agreement.

title: Classification of information
description: Classify information based on its value, legal requirements, sensitivity, and criticality to the organization.

title: Labelling of information
description: Develop and implement procedures for labelling information according to the classification scheme.

title: Information transfer
description: Establish procedures and controls to protect information transferred within the organization and with external entities.

title: Access control
description: Define and implement access control rules, rights and restrictions based on business and security requirements.

title: Identity management
description: Establish and manage identities and credentials for authorized users, devices and services throughout their lifecycle.

title: Authentication information
description: Manage authentication information (e.g., passwords, tokens, certificates) to ensure it is issued securely and maintained confidential.

title: Access rights
description: Manage access rights to information, information processing facilities and business processes.

title: Information security in supplier relationships
description: Establish and maintain information security in supplier relationships consistent with the organization's risk management approach.

title: Addressing information security within supplier agreements
description: Include information security requirements in supplier agreements to mitigate risks associated with supplier access to assets.

title: Managing information security in the ICT supply chain
description: Establish and maintain processes, procedures and controls to manage information security risks in the ICT supply chain.

title: Monitoring, review and change management of supplier services
description: Regularly monitor, review, audit, and manage changes to supplier services to maintain information security.

title: Information security for use of cloud services
description: Establish processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services according to security requirements.

title: Information security incident management planning and preparation
description: Plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating processes, roles and responsibilities.

title: Assessment and decision on information security events
description: Assess information security events and decide if they are to be classified as information security incidents.

title: Response to information security incidents
description: Respond to information security incidents in accordance with documented procedures.

title: Learning from information security incidents
description: Learn from information security incidents and apply lessons learned to improve incident management processes and controls.

title: Collection of evidence
description: Establish and implement procedures for identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence related to information security incidents.

title: Information security during disruption
description: Plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption (e.g., during a crisis or disaster).

title: ICT readiness for business continuity
description: Implement ICT readiness for business continuity to ensure availability of information processing facilities.

title: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
description: Identify and have access to legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements relevant to information security.

title: Intellectual property rights
description: Protect intellectual property rights in accordance with legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements.

title: Protection of records
description: Protect records from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and release in accordance with requirements.

title: Privacy and protection of PII
description: Ensure privacy and protection of personally identifiable information (PII) in accordance with legal and contractual requirements.

title: Independent review of information security
description: Conduct independent reviews of the organization's information security and approach to managing it at planned intervals.

title: Compliance with policies, rules and standards for information security
description: Ensure compliance with the organization's information security policies, rules and standards.

title: Documented operating procedures
description: Document operating procedures for information security and make them available to all relevant personnel.

title: Screening
description: Verify background checks on all candidates for employment, contractors and third-party users in accordance with relevant laws and regulations.

title: Terms and conditions of employment
description: Define and communicate information security responsibilities in employment contracts, agreements and policies.

title: Information security awareness, education and training
description: Ensure all personnel receive appropriate information security awareness, education and training.

title: Disciplinary process
description: Establish a formal disciplinary process for personnel who have committed an information security policy violation.

title: Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
description: Define and assign responsibilities for performing employment termination or change procedures.

title: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
description: Identify requirements for confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization's needs for information protection.

title: Remote working
description: Protect information accessed, processed or stored at remote working sites to the same level as within the organization's premises.

title: Information security event reporting
description: Ensure all personnel, contractors and third-party users are made aware of their responsibility to report information security events.

title: Physical security perimeters
description: Define and implement security perimeters to protect areas containing information processing facilities.

title: Physical entry controls
description: Secure areas should be protected by appropriate entry controls to ensure only authorized personnel are allowed access.

title: Securing offices, rooms and facilities
description: Design and implement physical security for offices, rooms and facilities to prevent unauthorized access, damage and interference.

title: Physical security monitoring
description: Monitor physical premises for unauthorized access or activities.

title: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
description: Protect information processing facilities against physical and environmental threats (e.g., fire, flood, earthquake).

title: Working in secure areas
description: Protect information in secure areas through procedures for working in such areas.

title: Clear desk and clear screen
description: Adopt clear desk policy for papers and removable storage media, and clear screen policy for information processing facilities.

title: Equipment siting and protection
description: Site and protect equipment to minimize risks from environmental threats, hazards and unauthorized access.

title: Security of assets off-premises
description: Protect off-site assets from unauthorized access, damage and interference.

title: Storage media
description: Manage storage media throughout its lifecycle to prevent unauthorized disclosure, modification, removal or destruction of information.

title: Supporting utilities
description: Protect equipment supporting utilities (e.g., electricity, water, telecommunications) from failures or malfunctions.

title: Cabling security
description: Protect power and telecommunications cabling carrying data or supporting information services from damage, interception or interference.

title: Equipment maintenance
description: Maintain equipment correctly to ensure availability and integrity.

title: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
description: Dispose of or re-use equipment containing storage media securely to avoid leakage of sensitive information.

title: User endpoint devices
description: Establish and implement security requirements for user endpoint devices, including remote access.

title: Privileged access rights
description: Restrict and control privileged access rights based on the principle of least privilege.

title: Information access restriction
description: Restrict access to information and application systems in accordance with access control policy.

title: Access to source code
description: Restrict access to source code and related items (designs, specifications, verification plans).

title: Secure authentication
description: Implement secure authentication practices and mechanisms based on the risks associated with access.

title: Capacity management
description: Monitor, tune and forecast capacity requirements to ensure system performance and availability.

title: Protection against malware
description: Implement and maintain protection against malware, including detection, prevention and recovery controls.

title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
description: Manage technical vulnerabilities in information systems through timely identification, evaluation and treatment.

title: Configuration management
description: Establish and maintain configuration management to ensure hardware, software and services are configured securely.

title: Information deletion
description: Delete information when no longer required, using secure deletion methods appropriate to the sensitivity of information.

title: Data masking
description: Use data masking to protect sensitive information in non-production environments.

title: Data leakage prevention
description: Implement measures to prevent data leakage through endpoints, networks and systems.

title: Information backup
description: Establish and implement backup processes and controls to protect against data loss.

title: Redundancy of information processing facilities
description: Implement redundancy for information processing facilities to ensure availability requirements are met.

title: Logging
description: Generate, store, protect and analyze event logs to record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events.

title: Monitoring activities
description: Monitor networks, systems and applications for anomalous behavior and potential security incidents.

title: Clock synchronization
description: Synchronize clocks of all relevant information processing systems to a single reference time source.

title: Use of privileged utility programs
description: Restrict and control the use of utility programs that could override system and application controls.

title: Installation of software on operational systems
description: Establish and implement procedures to control installation of software on operational systems.

title: Networks security
description: Protect information in networks and supporting infrastructure from security threats.

title: Security of network services
description: Identify security features, service levels and management requirements for network services.

title: Segregation of networks
description: Segment networks into different security domains based on risk assessment and business requirements.

title: Web filtering
description: Manage access to external websites to reduce exposure to malicious content.

title: Use of cryptography
description: Define and implement cryptographic controls to protect information confidentiality, authenticity and integrity.

title: Secure development life cycle
description: Establish and apply rules for secure development of software and systems, including secure design principles.

title: Application security requirements
description: Specify security requirements for the development, acquisition or use of applications and services.

title: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
description: Apply secure system architecture and engineering principles to the development of systems and services.

title: Secure coding
description: Apply secure coding principles and practices in software development.

title: Security testing in development and acceptance
description: Test security functionality during development and acceptance, including vulnerability scanning and penetration testing.

title: Outsourced development
description: Manage security of outsourced system development activities, including code review and testing.

title: Separation of development, test and production environments
description: Separate development, test and production environments to reduce risks of unauthorized access or changes.

title: Change management
description: Control changes to information processing facilities and systems through formal change management procedures.

title: Test information
description: Protect test information appropriately and ensure it is not used in operational environments.

title: Protection of information systems during audit testing
description: Protect operational systems and information during audit testing to prevent compromise.
